description: Zebras are African equids known for distinctive black-and-white striping, living in herds and grazing on grasses.
They use stripes for social signalling and potentially predator confusion.
Zebu are domesticated cattle breeds with a characteristic hump, adapted to tropical climates and used widely in agriculture.
They are important livestock across South Asia and other regions.
The zorilla (striped polecat) is a skunk-like mustelid from Africa capable of spraying a strong-smelling secretion for defence.
They are nocturnal and feed on small vertebrates and invertebrates.
Zander is a freshwater predatory fish in Eurasia, prized in fisheries and similar in ecology to pike-perch.
They feed on smaller fish and inhabit lakes and rivers.
Zokors are burrowing rodents native to Asia, similar in habit to moles and adapted to life underground.
They feed on roots and tubers and create extensive burrow systems.
